intro: Monodora somalensis, commonly known as the Somali African satinwood, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and compound leaves with three to five leaflets. Its fruit is a woody capsule that contains several seeds, and it is valued for its aromatic wood used in traditional crafts. The plant also has medicinal uses in some African cultures.
